title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, detained by ICE in 2025, invited to State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes was arrested en route to volleyball practice; ICE targeted his father over visa expiration.
Gomes' detention sparked community protests; Rep. Moulton highlights his case as illustration of systemic immigration issues.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal in Team USA's win over Denmark in Olympic hockey on Saturday.
Swayman humorously dismissed suggestions his performance was hindered by black boards, joking about being colorblind.
Team USA, backed by strong offense, may move to other goalkeepers as they approach the elimination tournament.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum nears return from Achilles injury; Celtics hold second seed in Eastern Conference.
Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony express anticipation for Tatum's potential impact on the Celtics.
Tatum has increased recent practice activity, including sessions with Celtics' G League affiliate.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have approximately $41 million in cap space entering the offseason, allowing room for acquisitions.
Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker are potential targets to enhance the Patriots' offensive capabilities.
Ravens TE Isaiah Likely and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips emerge as logical additions to strengthen key position areas.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: MLB.TV can be added to ESPN Unlimited for $134.99 or purchased separately for $149.99 for non-subscribers.
Subscribers to certain providers like Fubo and DirecTV may need to follow specific steps listed on ESPN's MLB.TV signup page.
Existing MLB.TV users will auto-renew, with ESPN Unlimited free trial offered but not required for continued use.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Celtics' G League affiliate, fueling speculation of his return.
Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement about Tatum's performance in practice, but there's no confirmed return date yet.
Celtics President Brad Stevens emphasized Tatum won't return until fully ready, with no timeline given for his comeback.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the U.S. in WalletHub's 2026 study.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, and 22% have a graduate or professional degree.
Vermont and Maryland ranked second and third, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked lowest.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card is up for auction and the bid is currently $3.9 million.
The card was originally obtained by Morton Bernstein in the early 1900s and has Massachusetts connections.
This ungraded card has been in the same family for 116 years and is now being sold via Ken Goldin's auction.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start in net for Team USA against Denmark in the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Swayman, aged 27, has been active in international tournaments, winning 2025 IIHF World Championship with Team USA.
Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy and Swayman will both play in Team USA's preliminary round game against Denmark.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: New England Aquarium identified a dead North Atlantic right whale off Virginia as a 3-year-old female calf of 'Porcia.'
The whale's death is the second right whale fatality in two weeks, amid ongoing concerns for the endangered species.
The death marks the 43rd confirmed mortality in the North Atlantic Right Whale Unusual Mortality Event since 2017.
